com.gigya.socialize.android

Class GSAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gigya.socialize.android.GSAPI

  • public class GSAPI
extends java.lang.Object
    The central class of the Gigya Android SDK. Instances of the GSAPI class provide access to the Gigya service.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  GSAPI.LoginBehavior
      An enum specifying the desired login behavior.

      • getSession

      • setSession

        public void setSession(GSSession session)
        Store the session in the app's local storage. This method is designated for the case in which a user logs in to your app using your own login system (the app's username and password) instead of Gigya's social login. Learn more in Site Login guide.
        Parameters:
        session - the new session. This is a GSSession object that must be initialized with the sessionToken and sessionSecret you have received from Gigya (in the response of a socialize.notifyLogin API call).

        apiDomain - The Gigya API domain to use for requests.

      • login

        public GSLoginRequest login(GSObject params,
                   GSResponseListener listener,
                   java.lang.Object context)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Login the user to a specified provider. Opens a WebDialog. The provider name is passed via the params.
        Parameters:
        params - a GSObject object that contains the parameters for the Gigya API method to call. The supported parameters are:
          • provider (mandatory) - the provider that will be used for authenticating the user, e.g. "facebook", "twitter", etc. Please refer to SDKs guide for the list of supported providers.
          • cid (optional) - a string of maximum 100 characters length. This string will be associated with each transaction and will later appear on reports generated by Gigya, in the "Context ID" combo box. The cid allows you to associate the report information with your own internal data. The "Context ID" combo box lets you filter the report data by application appContext.
          • forceAuthentication (optional) - The default value of this parameter is 'false'. If set to 'true', the user will be forced to provide her social network credentials during the login, even if she is already connected to the social network. Please note, that the behavior of the various social networks may be slightly different. For example, Facebook expects the current user to enter his password, and would not accept a different user name.
          • facebookReadPermissions (optional) - A comma delimited list of Facebook extended permissions to request from the user when using native login. This parameter gives the possibility to request extended permissions in addition to the permissions that Gigya is already requesting. Please refer to Facebook's permissions documentation for the complete list of read permissions. Note: you should only include read permissions, otherwise Facebook will fail the login.
          • facebookLoginBehavior (optional) - A string with a value from Facebook's SessionLoginBehavior
        listener - an object implementing GSResponseListener, that will be invoked when the login process completes. The listener object should handle Gigya's response.
        context - a developer-created object that will be passed back unchanged to the application as one of the parameters of the GSResponseListener.onGSResponse method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • login

        public GSLoginRequest login(GSObject params,
                   GSResponseListener listener,
                   boolean silent,
                   java.lang.Object context)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Login the user to a specified provider. Opens a WebDialog. The provider name is passed via the params.
        Parameters:
        params - a GSObject object that contains the parameters for the Gigya API method to call. The supported parameters are:
          • provider (mandatory) - the provider that will be used for authenticating the user, e.g. "facebook", "twitter", etc. Please refer to SDKs guide for the list of supported providers.
          • cid (optional) - a string of maximum 100 characters length. This string will be associated with each transaction and will later appear on reports generated by Gigya, in the "Context ID" combo box. The cid allows you to associate the report information with your own internal data. The "Context ID" combo box lets you filter the report data by application appContext.
          • forceAuthentication (optional) - The default value of this parameter is 'false'. If set to 'true', the user will be forced to provide her social network credentials during the login, even if she is already connected to the social network. Please note, that the behavior of the various social networks may be slightly different. For example, Facebook expects the current user to enter his password, and would not accept a different user name.
          • facebookReadPermissions (optional) - A comma delimited list of Facebook extended permissions to request from the user when using native login. This parameter gives the possibility to request extended permissions in addition to the permissions that Gigya is already requesting. Please refer to Facebook's permissions documentation for the complete list of read permissions. Note: you should only include read permissions, otherwise Facebook will fail the login.
          • facebookLoginBehavior (optional) - A string with a value from Facebook's SessionLoginBehavior
        listener - an object implementing GSResponseListener, that will be invoked when the login process completes. The listener object should handle Gigya's response.
        silent - when set to true, login will be attempted without displaying any user interface (currently supported only with Google+ cross platform auth).
        context - a developer-created object that will be passed back unchanged to the application as one of the parameters of the GSResponseListener.onGSResponse method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • showLoginUI

        public void showLoginUI(GSObject params,
               GSLoginUIListener uiListener,
               java.lang.Object context)
        Displays a dialog for selecting a social network to login to. The UI includes all the available providers' icons as login options, enabling the user to login via his social network / webmail account.
        Parameters:
        params - a GSObject object that contains the parameters for the Gigya API method to call. The supported parameters are:
          • enabledProviders (optional) - a comma delimited list of providers that should be displayed on the UI. The list also defines the order in which the icons will be presented. Please refer to s guide for the list of supported providers.
          • disabledProviders (optional) - a comma delimited list of providers that should not be displayed on the UI.
          • captionText (optional) - sets the caption text.
          • cid (optional) - a string of maximum 100 characters length. This string will be associated with each transaction and will later appear on reports generated by Gigya, in the "Context ID" combo box. The cid allows you to associate the report information with your own internal data. The "Context ID" combo box lets you filter the report data by application appContext.
          • forceAuthentication (optional) - The default value of this parameter is 'false'. If set to 'true', the user will be forced to provide her social network credentials during the login, even if she is already connected to the social network. Please note, that the behavior of the various social networks may be slightly different. For example, Facebook expects the current user to enter his password, and would not accept a different user name.
          • facebookReadPermissions (optional) - A comma delimited list of Facebook extended permissions to request from the user when using native login. This parameter gives the possibility to request extended permissions in addition to the permissions that Gigya is already requesting. Please refer to Facebookâ€™s permissions documentation for the complete list of read permissions. Note: you should only include read permissions, otherwise Facebook will fail the login.
          • facebookLoginBehavior (optional) - A string with a value from Facebook's SessionLoginBehavior
        uiListener - an object implementing GSLoginUIListener, that will be invoked when the login process completes. The listener object will receive from Gigya the login response. On successful login, the response will include user data.
        context - a developer-created object that will be passed back unchanged to the application as one of the parameters of the GSResponseListener.onGSResponse method.

      • showPluginDialog

        public void showPluginDialog(java.lang.String pluginName,
                    GSObject params,
                    GSPluginListener pluginListener,
                    GSDialogListener dialogListener)
        Uses GSPluginFragment to render a Gigya JS plugin and display it modally. To set the dialog's title, pass the desired title as the "captionText" parameter.
        Parameters:
        pluginName - A plugin name of a supported plugin, see GSPluginFragment for a list.
        params - The parameters passed to the plugin.
        pluginListener - A listener that will receive plugin events.
        dialogListener - A listener that will be invoked when the dialog is dismissed.
        See Also:
        GSPluginFragment

      • reportDeepLink

        public void reportDeepLink(android.content.Intent intent)
        Tracks and counts deep link referral traffic, to be used after opening deep links. The accumulation of the referral tracking is presented in the Referred Traffic report on Gigya's website.
        Parameters:
        intent - The deep link intent the app was opened with.

      • reportURIReferral

        public void reportURIReferral(android.net.Uri uri,
                     java.lang.String provider)
        Tracks and counts referral traffic. The accumulation of the referral tracking is presented in the Referred Traffic report on Gigya's website.
        Parameters:
        uri - The URI used to open the app.
        provider - The social network the referral originated from.

      • logout

        public void logout()
        Logs out the current user, clearing the sessions both for Gigya and native login providers.

      • addConnection

        public GSLoginRequest addConnection(GSObject params,
                           GSResponseListener listener,
                           java.lang.Object context)
                             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Add a social network connection to the current user. Technically speaking, a connection is an established session with the social network and it expires according to the social network policy. A valid and active connection will give your application access to the user's social graph and ability to perform various social actions, such as publishing a newsfeed report to the connected social network.
        Parameters:
        params - a GSObject object that contains the parameters for the Gigya API method to call. The supported parameters are:
          • provider (mandatory) - the name of the social network to connect to. e.g. "facebook", "twitter", etc.
          • cid (optional) - a string of maximum 100 characters length. This string will be associated with each transaction and will later appear on reports generated by Gigya, in the "Context ID" combo box. The cid allows you to associate the report information with your own internal data. The "Context ID" combo box lets you filter the report data by application appContext.
          • facebookReadPermissions (optional) - A comma delimited list of Facebook extended permissions to request from the user when using native login. This parameter gives the possibility to request extended permissions in addition to the permissions that Gigya is already requesting. Please refer to Facebook's permissions documentation for the complete list of read permissions. Note: you should only include read permissions, otherwise Facebook will fail the login.
          • facebookLoginBehavior (optional) - A string with a value from Facebook's SessionLoginBehavior
        listener - an object implementing GSResponseListener, that will be invoked when the add connection process completes. The listener object should handle Gigya's response.
        context - a developer-created object that will be passed back unchanged to the application as one of the parameters of the GSResponseListener.onGSResponse method.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • removeConnection

        public void removeConnection(GSObject params,
                    GSResponseListener listener,
                    java.lang.Object context)
        Removes an existing Social Network connection from the current user (the provider is specified via params).
        Parameters:
        params - a GSObject object that contains the parameters for the Gigya API method to call. The supported parameters are:
          • provider (mandatory) - the name of the provider to disconnect from, e.g. "facebook", "twitter", etc.
          • cid (optional) - a string of maximum 100 characters length. This string will be associated with each transaction and will later appear on reports generated by Gigya, in the "Context ID" combo box. The cid allows you to associate the report information with your own internal data. The "Context ID" combo box lets you filter the report data by application appContext.
        listener - an object implementing GSResponseListener, that will be invoked when the remove connection process completes. The listener object should handle Gigya's response.
        context - a developer-created object that will be passed back unchanged to the application as one of the parameters of the GSResponseListener.onGSResponse method.

      • showAddConnectionsUI

        public void showAddConnectionsUI(GSObject params,
                        GSConnectUIListener uiListener,
                        java.lang.Object context)
        Displays an "Add Connections" UI, which enables establishing connections to social networks. The UI presents the available social network icons as connect options.
        Parameters:
        params - a GSObject object that contains the parameters for the Gigya API method to call. The supported parameters are:
          • enabledProviders (optional) - a comma delimited list of providers that should be displayed on the UI. The list also defines the order in which the icons will be presented. Please refer to Gigya's wiki for the list of supported providers.
          • disabledProviders (optional) - a comma delimited list of providers that should not be displayed on the UI.
          • captionText (optional) - sets the caption text.
          • cid (optional) - a string of maximum 100 characters length. This string will be associated with each transaction and will later appear on reports generated by Gigya, in the "Context ID" combo box. The cid allows you to associate the report information with your own internal data. The "Context ID" combo box lets you filter the report data by application appContext.
          • facebookReadPermissions (optional) - A comma delimited list of Facebook extended permissions to request from the user when using native login. This parameter gives the possibility to request extended permissions in addition to the permissions that Gigya is already requesting. Please refer to Facebook's permissions documentation for the complete list of read permissions. Note: you should only include read permissions, otherwise Facebook will fail the login.
          • facebookLoginBehavior (optional) - A string with a value from Facebook's SessionLoginBehavior
        uiListener - an object implementing GSConnectUIListener, for listening to UI events. The listener will also be invoked when the connect process completes. On successful connect, the connect response will include user data.
        context - a developer-created object that will be passed back unchanged to the application as one of the parameters of the GSResponseListener.onGSResponse method.

      • sendRequest

        public void sendRequest(java.lang.String method,
               GSObject params,
               GSResponseListener listener,
               java.lang.Object context)
        Sends a request to Gigya server. This method is used for invoking any of the methods supported by Gigya's REST API.
        Parameters:
        method - the Gigya API method to call, including namespace. For example: "socialize.getUserInfo". Please refer to our REST API reference for the list of available methods.
        params - a GSObject object that contains the parameters for the Gigya API method to call. Please refer to our REST API reference and find in the specific method reference the list of method parameters.
        listener - an object implementing GSResponseListener, that will be invoked along with response data when Gigya completes to process the request. The listener object should handle Gigya's response.
        context - this object will be passed untouched and received back in the response.

      • sendRequest

        public void sendRequest(java.lang.String method,
               GSObject params,
               boolean useHTTPS,
               GSResponseListener listener,
               java.lang.Object context)
        Sends a request to Gigya server. This method is used for invoking any of the methods supported by Gigya's REST API.
        Parameters:
        method - the Gigya API method to call, including namespace. For example: "socialize.getUserInfo". Please refer to our REST API reference for the list of available methods.
        params - a GSObject object that contains the parameters for the Gigya API method to call. Please refer to our REST API reference and find in the specific method reference the list of method parameters.
        useHTTPS - this parameter determines whether the request to Gigya will be sent over HTTP or HTTPS. To send of HTTPS, please set this parameter to true.
        listener - an object implementing GSResponseListener, that will be invoked along with response data when Gigya completes to process the request. The listener object should handle Gigya's response.
        context - this object will be passed untouched and received back in the response.

      • getLastLoginProvider

        public java.lang.String getLastLoginProvider()
        Returns the provider used for last login.

      • requestFacebookPublishPermissions

        public void requestFacebookPublishPermissions(java.util.List<java.lang.String> permissions,
                                     GSPermissionResultHandler callback)
                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Asks the user for Facebook publish permissions. This method works only with Facebook native login, and must be called after the user logged in.
        Parameters:
        permissions - A comma delimited list of Facebook publish permissions to request from the user. Please refer to Facebook's documentation for a complete list of possible values.
        callback - completion handler that will be invoked when the process if finished.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
